Description: Fragment of a gold necklace; comprised two gold spacers bars hammered from sheet metal with wire loops on either side of a circular glass or glazed composition (faience) bead; connecting sections made from twisted gold wire.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2713)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.119, Tomb 75)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 95, p. 29)
